Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured pottery kantharos; interior: glazed black with single added white band; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of dolphin (tip of head and tail missing), diving to left; below, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the dolphin motif, see also Oxford AN1896-1908-G.128.6
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 333, no. 1631)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1898) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
